meanings.definition: A white crystalline powder used as a local anesthetic.
meanings.sent1: The dentist applied benzocaine to numb my gums before the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist recommended benzocaine for the sore throat.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled benzocaine on the table, and now it looks like snow!
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like benzocaine, soothing the tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The sensation of benzocaine melting on my skin was like a gentle breeze on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To numb or relieve pain with benzocaine.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will benzocaine the area before stitching the wound.
meanings.sent2: She benzocained her sunburn to ease the discomfort.
meanings.sent3: I benzocaine my worries away whenever I have a toothache.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like benzocaine, calming her fears instantly.
meanings.sent5: The soothing effect of benzocaine spread through her body like a warm blanket on a cold night.
